title: Understanding Grouping in SQL
text: Grouping in SQL is used to aggregate data based on one or more columns. It helps in organizing data into categories for better analysis.

title: Why Use Multiple Grouping Columns?
text: Using multiple columns in a GROUP BY clause allows you to create subgroups within your data, providing more detailed insights.

title: Example of Grouping by Two Columns
text: If you have a dataset with cities and counties, grouping by both can help differentiate between cities with the same name in different counties.

hintAnswer: To distinguish Hart in Bell county from Hart in Joshua county
title: Applying the Concept to Jamal's Database
text: Consider Jamal's database with internet traffic data. Why would grouping by both city and county be beneficial?
choices: To order the results first by county and then by city
To eliminate the state field from the results
To distinguish Hart in Bell county from Hart in Joshua county
